page.title: 19Tiny Taynton.
page.content: Taynton is a small village about four killometres from Huntley and twelve from Gloucester.The village has no obvious centre and the church and local'pub' are five km apart.The area is mostly fields with a few farms. The church is named after Saint Lawrence.It was burnt down in the Civil War and rebuilt during the Commonwealth.It was the only church in Gloucestershire built during this period.It was aligned north and south. Taynton has been called different names through the ages,for example, Tatinton,Tetinton,Thetington,Teintona, Teignton and lastly Taynton.
